articles.title: Scanty rainfall hits cardamom production, prices set to spiral to record levels - Moneycontrol
articles.description: As prices of cardamom rise, India is in danger of losing its export markets to the cheaper Guatemalan cardamom. Even the upcoming festive season may not help its cause as higher prices may impact the price-sensitive domestic market as well.
articles.content:
Cardamom prices are spiraling to record levels as severely deficient rainfall wreaks havoc in Idukki district in Kerala, where most of the countrys cardamom is grown.
